PROBLEM LIST:

00/00/05

4. Osteopenia, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
5. Postsurgical hypothyroidism, Onset 00/00/02        05/10/12  PROVIDER,ONE 
     Complete thryoidectomy for thyroid cancer in 2002.
6. Depression, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
7. Hypertension, Onset 00/00/05                       11/09/08  PROVIDER,ONE 

-------------------------------------------------------------------

METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE

-------------------------------------------------------------------

8)   SIMVASTATIN TAB  80MG PO QPM                           ACTIVE

-------------------------------------------------------------------

consciousness

-------------------------------------------------------------------

            B/P:  127/76 (02/26/2013 08:00)
          Pulse:  78 (02/26/2013 08:00)
    Temperature:  98.7 F [37.1 C] (02/26/2013 08:00)
   Respirations:  16 (02/26/2013 08:00)
         Weight:  241 lb [109.5 kg] (11/20/2012 16:31)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (11/20/2012 16:31)
            BMI:  41
           Pain:  0 (02/26/2013 08:00)

-------------------------------------------------------------------

    No sign of trauma. 
  EYE EXAM -

    RIGHT EYE: Not examined

    No murmur 
    No edema.

    No organomegaly 
    Bowel sounds: Normal. 

  RECTAL:  Not Examined.
  PSYCHIATRIC: 
           JUDGMENT: Good
            INSIGHT: Good
        ORIENTATION: Oriented X3 
               MOOD: Alert
      RECENT MEMORY: Good
      REMOTE MEMORY: Good

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Labs:
        02/26/13  7:22    FINGERSTICK GLUCOS   114H

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Subjective, assessment and plan:

#. Diabetes:
S: doing well; BG levels have been appropriate inpatient.
A/P: well controlled.  continue current management.  A1C lab due.

#. HTN: 
S: see ROS above.
A/P: well controlled; continue current management.

#. Depression:
S: pt feeling much better today.  Slept well and is feeling hopeful for the 
future. No SI since yesterday.  She feels she will be ready to go home soon.
A/P: doing better. continue current medications.  Re-evaluate later today or 
tomorrow to assess appropriateness for discharge.  Discontinue 1:1 sitter.
text.author: AVIVAUSER,SEVEN

text.content:
Patient Health Questionnaire - 9 (PHQ-9)
 
 Date Given: 02/26/2013
 Clinician: Avivauser,Seven
 Location: Psychiatry
 
 Veteran: Avivapatient, Six
 SSN: xxx-xx-0926
 DOB: Feb 2,1957 (56)
 Gender: Female
 
    PHQ-9 Depression Scale Score: 12
 
 Guide for Interpreting PHQ-9 scores:
   0-4: The score suggests the patient may not need depression treatment.
   5-14: Physician uses clinical judgment about treatment based on 
             patient's duration of symptoms and functional impairment.
   15 or more: Warrants treatment for depression, using antidepressant, 
             psychotherapy and/or a combination of treatment.
 
 Questions and Answers
 
 Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the 
following problems?
 1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things
     Several days
 2. Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
     More than half the days
 3. Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
     Several days
 4. Feeling tired or having little energy
     More than half the days
 5. Poor appetite or overeating
     Several days
 6. Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure or have let yourself 
or your family down
     More than half the days
 7. Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching 
television
     Several days
 8. Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the 
opposite being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot 
more than usual
     Several days
 9. Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some 
way
     Several days
 10. If you checked off any problems, how DIFFICULT have these problems made it 
for you to do your work, take care of things at home or get along with other 
people?
     Very difficult
 
 Information contained in this note is based on a self report assessment and is 
not sufficient to use alone for diagnostic purposes. Assessment results should 
be verified for accuracy and used in conjunction with other diagnostic 
activities.
